Appearance
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

This article contains a list of all matches played during the 2022 Super Rugby Pacific regular season.[1] On 23 December 2021, a revised draw was announced due to complications surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic.[2] On 2 February 2022, it was announced that the opening two rounds of matches featuring New Zealand teams, and Moana Pasifika, would take place in Queenstown, with the six sides being placed in bio-secure bubbles due to the threat of COVID-19.[3] On 20 February, the New Zealand-based Round 2 fixtures were reshuffled to allow Moana Pasifika more time to recover, following positive COVID-19 cases in their squad.[4]

See also

[edit]
  • 2022 Super Rugby Pacific season

Notes

[edit]
  1. ^ a b The match between the Brumbies and the Force was meant to be held at HBF Park, Perth, however due to COVID-19 restrictions in Western Australia the venue was swapped to GIO Stadium, Canberra, with the Round 6 fixture now to be played at HBF Park, Perth.
  2. ^ The match between Moana Pasifika and the Blues was meant to be held on 18 February 2022, but due to several Moana Pasifika players testing positive for COVID-19, the match was postponed and rescheduled for 29 March 2022.[8][9]
  3. ^ The match between the Drua and the Rebels was meant to be held at Suncorp Stadium, Brisbane, however due to flooding in Brisbane, the match was moved to Sunshine Coast Stadium, Kawana Waters.[11]
  4. ^ The match between the Blues and the Highlanders was meant to be held at Semenoff Stadium, Whangārei, however due to COVID-19 restrictions, the game was moved to North Harbour Stadium, Albany.[15]
  5. ^ a b The match between the Waratahs and the Force was meant to be held at HBF Park, Perth, however due to COVID-19 restrictions in Australia the venue was swapped to Leichhardt Oval, Sydney, with the Round 9 fixture now to be played at HBF Park, Perth.
  6. ^ The match between the Hurricanes and Moana Pasifika was meant to be held on 12 March 2022, but due to several Hurricanes players testing positive for COVID-19, the match was postponed, and rescheduled for 12 April 2022.[17][18]
  7. ^ The match between Moana Pasifika and the Chiefs was meant to be held on 16 April 2022, but due to COVID-19 cancellation of matches in Round 5, the match was moved forward to 19 March 2022.[20]
  8. ^ The match between the Hurricanes and Chiefs was meant to be held on 20 March 2022, but due to several positive COVID-19 tests in the Hurricanes squad, the match was postponed, and rescheduled for 3 April 2022.[20][18]
  9. ^ The match between the Highlanders and Moana Pasifika was meant to be held on 21 March 2022, but due to several positive COVID-19 tests in the Highlanders squad, the match was postponed, and rescheduled for 8 April 2022.[20][18]
  10. ^ The match between the Crusaders and Blues was meant to be held on 19 March 2022, but due to several positive COVID-19 tests in both squads, the match was postponed, and rescheduled for 15 April 2022.[20][18]
  11. ^ The match between Moana Pasifika and the Force was meant to be held on 22 April 2022, but due to several Force players testing positive for COVID-19, the match was postponed, and rescheduled for 24 May 2022, while the venue was changed from AAMI Park, Melbourne to Mt Smart Stadium, Auckland.[35][36]
  12. ^ The match between the Drua and the Chiefs was meant to be held at Cbus Super Stadium, Gold Coast, however due to the relaxation of COVID-19 restrictions the game was able to be hosted in Fiji, with Churchill Park, Lautoka selected as the new venue.[37]
